tweet: We cannot go back to a broken health insurance system that makes it more expensive, if not impossible, to find coverage when you get sick. The Senate should come together, reject the admin’s continued actions to sabotage the ACA & instead work to tackle rising health care costs.

This will promote a race to the bottom for health care coverage standards & protections that patients count on. It will incentivize consumers to drop health care plans that provide quality coverage & cover pre-existing conditions, & then purchase junk insurance that does neither. https://twitter.com/washingtonpost/status/1068191853269397504 …
Important to recognize and appreciate the service of our brave men and women overseas this holiday season. pic.twitter.com/FpWEylWjHL

By not acting on climate change, we are forfeiting our children’s future. Overwhelming evidence shows it is devastating our environment. Recent reports show how it will hurt our economy, and it’s already harming infrastructure. The admin needs to accept science & act. https://twitter.com/nhpr/status/1068531400276672512 …
Keeping everyone impacted by the earthquake in Anchorage, Alaska in my thoughts, and praying for first responders. If you or members of your family are affected, please stay safe.

I will do everything in my power to stop this permitting and any efforts to move forward with Atlantic drilling. The Senate should move quickly to consider legislation that I’ve cosponsored with @SenBooker to bar seismic testing in the Atlantic.
The environmental impact of this decision would be catastrophic, further depleting the whale population and many other species that we cherish and are important to our economy.
These seismic tests are an immediate threat to our fishing industry, in addition to the long-term threat to NH’s economy & outdoor recreation industry posed by an oil or gas leak from drilling.
The Trump administration is laying the groundwork for an environmental disaster on NH’s Seacoast. https://wapo.st/2SkT7J0

Global health orgs must always remain a foreign policy priority. Very encouraged by the bicameral, bipartisan support last night to reauthorize @PEPFAR & ensure their efforts move forward to curb the spread of HIV/AIDS & help those living w/ it access their lifesaving treatment.

This afternoon I hosted a card-writing party with my staff as part of Laura Landerman-Garber’s Holiday Cards 4 Our Military–NH Challenge. Laura has collected more than 45k cards to bring some holiday cheer to our service members, and my office was excited to help out! pic.twitter.com/JjeQlSQfYu

Having a free and open internet is critical to allowing small businesses to operate online. Today I am joining the #NetNeutrality Day of Action to urge the House to vote on the Senate’s resolution to restore internet protections for consumers in NH and across the country.
I’m asking for a common sense ban on retroactive collection and an implementation delay so that Congress has time to protect small businesses from this unfair and unnecessary red tape.

It’s unacceptable that local small businesses will be forced to collect sales tax as soon as January 1st for other states, when NH is a sales-tax free state. I’m urging Senate leadership to act now to protect small business. pic.twitter.com/leUwi4AkGg

No patient should forgo the lifesaving care they need because the cost is out of reach, and I’ll keep working with @SenatorCollins & other members of Congress to confront the escalating insulin prices & prescription drug cost increases.

Americans living w/ diabetes often need insulin for survival, which makes skyrocketing prices so alarming. @SenatorCollins and I are asking the nation’s largest health insurance companies to explain the role insurance plans play in promoting affordable access to insulin products.

This is the world’s worst humanitarian crisis. If the admin does not take immediate steps, including ending U.S. refueling of Saudi coalition aircraft, we are prepared to take additional action when the Senate comes back into session.

.@SenToddYoung & I are calling on the admin to end U.S. air refueling of Saudi coalition aircraft in Yemen. With 14 million Yemenis on the verge of starvation, the U.S. must send a clear message that we expect Saudi Arabia to engage in negotiations to end the civil war.

It’s past time for Republicans and Democrats to work together to enact common sense gun safety measures.

Gun violence is a national crisis and must be addressed at the federal level. As this threat is ignored, it continues to get worse, and families across the country are terrified that the next shooting will strike their community.

The shooting last night in California is so heartbreaking. Once again, lives taken far too soon and trauma that will last a lifetime. My thoughts are with the victims’ families, survivors and local law enforcement who tragically lost one of their own.
Republicans and Democrats must set politics aside to protect the rule of law in our country.

Based on Matthew Whitaker’s previous statements, he should recuse himself from overseeing the Mueller probe. It is also imperative that Republican leadership finally allow bipartisan legislation to move forward that will protect the investigation.

The President is not above the law which is why it is incredibly concerning that President Trump has fired the Attorney General and handpicked an acting Attorney General who will now oversee Special Counsel Mueller’s investigation.
Andrea, without your leadership, we wouldn’t be where we are today on confronting this issue in your community. Thank you & congratulations.
